  "article_text": [
    "our inspiration is to understand the canonical model of the moduli space @xmath9 of stable curves of genus @xmath10 .",
    "this is known to be of general type for @xmath11 and @xmath12 @xcite . in these cases",
    ", we can consider the canonical ring @xmath13 which is finitely generated by a fundamental conjecture of birational geometry , recently proven in @xcite .",
    "then the corresponding projective variety @xmath14 is birational to @xmath9 and is called its _ canonical model_.",
    "there has been significant recent progress in understanding canonical models of moduli spaces . for moduli spaces @xmath15 of principally polarized abelian varieties of dimension @xmath16 , the canonical model exists and is equal to the first voronoi compactification @xcite .",
    "unfortunately , no analogous results are known for @xmath9 , even for @xmath17 .    our approach is to approximate the canonical models with _ log canonical models_. consider @xmath18\\cap { \\mathbb q}$ ] so that @xmath19 is an effective @xmath20-divisor .",
    "we have the graded ring @xmath21 and the resulting projective variety @xmath22    our previous paper @xcite describes @xmath0 explicitly for large values of @xmath23 . for simplicity",
    "we assume that @xmath24 : small genera cases have been considered in @xcite .",
    "for @xmath25 , @xmath0 is equal to @xmath9 .",
    "the first critical value is @xmath26 : @xmath27 is the coarse moduli space of the moduli stack @xmath28 of pseudostable curves @xcite .",
    "a pseudostable curve may have cusps but they are not allowed to have _ elliptic tails _ , i.e. , genus one subcurves meeting the rest of the curve in one point .",
    "furthermore , there is a divisorial contraction @xmath29 induced by the morphism @xmath30 of moduli stacks which replaces an elliptic tail with a cusp .",
    "furthermore , @xmath31 provided @xmath32 .",
    "this paper addresses what happens when @xmath33 .",
    "given a sufficiently small positive @xmath34 , we construct a small contraction and its flip : @xmath35 ^ -{\\psi } & & \\mg(\\frac7{10}-\\e ) \\ar[dl]_-{\\psi^+}\\\\ & \\mg(\\frac7{10 } ) & \\\\ } \\ ] ] the resulting spaces arise naturally as geometric invariant theory ( git ) quotients and admit partial modular descriptions .",
    "we construct @xmath4 as a git quotient of the chow variety of bicanonical curves ; it parametrizes equivalence classes of _ c - semistable curves_. we defer the formal definition , but these have nodes , cusps , and tacnodes as singularities .",
    "the flip @xmath5 is a git quotient of the hilbert scheme of bicanonical curves ; it parametrizes equivalence classes of _ h - semistable curves _ , which are c - semistable curves not admitting certain subcurves composed of elliptic curves ( see definition  [ d : h - stable ] ) .",
    "we may express the flip in geometric terms ( figure  [ fig : gf ] ) : let @xmath36 denote an _",
    "elliptic bridge _ , where @xmath37 is smooth of genus @xmath38 , @xmath39 is smooth of genus one , and @xmath37 meets @xmath39 at two nodes @xmath40 and @xmath41 .",
    "let @xmath42 be a tacnodal curve of genus @xmath10 , with normalization @xmath37 and conductor @xmath43 . in passing from @xmath44 to @xmath5 , we replace @xmath45 with @xmath42 .",
    "note that the descent data for @xmath42 includes the choice of an isomorphism of tangent spaces @xmath46 the collection of such identifications is a principal homogeneous space for @xmath47 .",
    "when @xmath45 is a generic elliptic bridge , the fiber @xmath48 ; see proposition  [ p : const - tac ] for an explicit interpretation of the endpoints .    here",
    "we offer a brief summary of the contents of this paper ; a more detailed roadmap can be found in section [ ss : detailed ] .",
    "section [ s : gitch ] is devoted to a general discussion of the git of chow points and hilbert points .",
    "the main applications are the analysis of tautological classes and polarizations on the hilbert scheme , the resulting formulas for hilbert - mumford indices ( proposition  [ prop : curveresult ] ) , and cycle maps ( corollary  [ coro : hilbtochow ] ) .",
    "we also recall various formulations of the hilbert - mumford one - parameter - subgroup criterion .",
    "section [ s : basin ] is a brief review of the basin - of - attraction techniques used in this paper .",
    "these are important for analyzing when distinct curves are identified in the git quotients .    section [ s : cms ] discusses , in general terms , how to obtain contractions of the moduli space of stable curves from git quotients of hilbert schemes .",
    "the resulting models of the moduli space depend on the choice of linearization ; we express the polarizations in terms of tautological classes .    section [ s : propchstable ] summarizes basic properties of c - semistable curves : embedding theorems and descent results for tacnodal curves . section [ s : ubc ] offers a preliminary analysis of the git of the hilbert scheme and the chow variety of bicanonically embedded curves of genus @xmath49 . then in section  [ s : automorphisms ] we enumerate the curves with positive - dimensional automorphism groups .",
    "section [ s : fgitq ] applies this to give a git construction of the flip @xmath7 .",
    "section [ s : hardwork ] offers a detailed orbit closure analysis , using basins of attractions and a careful analysis of the action of the automorphism group on tangent spaces .",
    "the main application is a precise description of the semistable and stable bicanonical curves , proven in section [ s : psa ] .    throughout",
    ", we work over an algebraically closed field @xmath50 , generally of characteristic zero .",
    "however , sections  [ s : gitch ] and [ s : propchstable ] are valid in positive characteristic .",
    "* acknowledgments : * the first author was partially supported by national science foundation grants 0196187 , 0134259 , and 0554491 , the sloan foundation , and the institute of mathematical sciences of the chinese university of hong kong .",
    "the second author was partially supported by the korea institute for advanced study and the korea science and engineering foundation ( kosef ) grant funded by the korea government ( most ) ( no .",
    "r01 - 2007 - 000 - 10948 - 0 ) .",
    "we owe a great deal to s. keel , who helped shape our understanding of the birational geometry of @xmath9 through detailed correspondence .",
    "we are also grateful to d. abramovich , y. kawamata , i. morrison , b.p .",
    "purnaprajna , m. simpson , d. smyth , and d. swinarski for useful conversations .",
    "in this paper , we will use four stability conditions : deligne - mumford stability @xcite , schubert pseudostability @xcite , c-(semi)stability , and h-(semi)stability .",
    "we recall the definition of _ pseudostability _ , which is obtained from deligne - mumford stability by allowing ordinary cusps and prohibiting elliptic tails :    [ d : p - stable]@xcite a complete curve is _ pseudostable _ if    1 .",
    "it is connected , reduced , and has only nodes and ordinary cusps as singularities ; 2 .",
    "admits no _ elliptic tails _ , i.e. , connected subcurves of arithmetic genus one meeting the rest of the curve in one node ; 3 .   the canonical sheaf of the curve is ample .",
    "the last condition means that each subcurve of genus zero meets the rest of the curve in at least three points .    before formulating the notions of c- and h-(semi)stability ,",
    "we need the following definition :    [ d : eb ] an _ elliptic bridge _ is a connected subcurve of arithmetic genus one meeting the rest of the curve in two nodes .        in our stability analysis",
    ", we will require additional technical definitions :    [ d : ech ] an _ open elliptic chain _ of length @xmath51 is a two - pointed projective curve @xmath52 such that    * @xmath53 where each @xmath54 is connected of genus one , with nodes , cusps or tacnodes as singularities ; * @xmath54 intersects @xmath55 at a single tacnode @xmath56 , for @xmath57 ; * @xmath58 if @xmath59 ; * @xmath60 are smooth points with @xmath61 and @xmath62 ; * @xmath63 is ample .",
    "an open elliptic chain of length @xmath51 has arithmetic genus @xmath64 .",
    "[ d : echain ] let @xmath45 be a projective connected curve of arithmetic genus @xmath65 , with nodes , cusps , and tacnodes as singularities .",
    "we say @xmath45 _ admits an open elliptic chain _ if there is an open elliptic chain @xmath66 and a morphism @xmath67 such that    * @xmath68 is an isomorphism over @xmath69 onto its image ; * @xmath70 are nodes of @xmath45 ; we allow the case @xmath71 , in which case @xmath45 is said to be a _ closed elliptic chain_.    @xmath45 admits a _ weak elliptic chain _ if there exists @xmath67 as above with the second condition replaced by    * @xmath72 is a tacnode of @xmath45 and @xmath73 is a node of @xmath45 ; or * @xmath71 is a tacnode of @xmath45 , in which case @xmath45 is said to be a _",
    "closed weak elliptic chain_.    now we are in a position to formulate our main stability notions :    [ d : c - stable ] a complete curve @xmath45 is said to be _ c - semistable _ if    1 .",
    "@xmath45 has nodes , cusps and tacnodes as singularities ; 2 .",
    "@xmath74 is ample ; 3 .",
    "a connected genus one subcurve meets the rest of the curve in at least two points ( not counting multiplicity ) .",
    "it is said to be _ c - stable _ if it is c - semistable and has no tacnodes or elliptic bridges .",
    "[ d : h - stable ] a complete curve @xmath45 of genus @xmath10 is said to be _ h - semistable _ if it is c - semistable and admits no elliptic chains .",
    "it is said to be _ h - stable _ if it is h - semistable and admits no weak elliptic chains .",
    "[ r : whatiscstable ] a curve is c - stable if and only if it is pseudostable and has no elliptic bridges .",
    "table  [ tab : stability ] summarizes the defining characteristics of the stability notions .",

    "h - stable ) curves .",
    "one difference from the case of chow points is that tacnodal curves may well be hilbert stable .",
    "for instance , when @xmath49 _ irreducible _ bicanonical h - semistable curves are necessarily h - stable .",
    "when @xmath179 , a bicanonical h - semistable curve is hilbert strictly semistable if and only if it has a tacnode @xcite .",
    "when @xmath180 , every h - semistable curve is h - stable and the moduli functor is thus separated .",
    "since c - stable curves are h - stable ( see proposition  [ prop : hilbtochow ] ) and pseudostable ( see remark  [ r : whatiscstable ] ) , we have    [ c : excep - psi ] @xmath8 and @xmath153 are isomorphisms over the locus of c - stable curves .",
    "thus @xmath8 is a small contraction with exceptional locus @xmath181 and @xmath153 is a small contraction with exceptional locus @xmath182 , the h - semistable curves with tacnodes .",
    "thus the geometry of the flip is as indicated in figure  [ fig : gf ] : @xmath183 precisely when @xmath45 is the ` pseudostable reduction ' of @xmath42 .",
    "the proof of theorems [ t : chow ] and [ t : hilbert ] is rather intricate , so we give a bird s eye view for the reader s convenience .",
    "\\(1 ) the following implications are straightforward :    * from the definitions , it is clear that : @xmath184 * general results on linearizations of chow and hilbert schemes ( proposition  [ prop : hilbtochow ] ) imply @xmath185 and @xmath186    \\(2 ) we next prove that non c - semistable ( resp .",

    "hilbert unstable ) .",
    "the main tool is the stability algorithm ( proposition  [ prop : stabcrit2 ] ) .",
    "* non c - semistable curves can be easily destabilized by one - parameter subgroups (  [ s : ubc ] ) .",
    "we obtain @xmath187 * we show that if a curve @xmath45 admits an _",
    "open rosary _ of even length ( see definition  [ d : rosary ] ) , then there is a 1-ps @xmath188 coming from the automorphism group of the rosary such that the _ @xmath189th hilbert point _",
    "@xmath190_m$ ] ( definition  [ d : mth - hilb - pt ] ) is unstable with respect to @xmath188 for all @xmath191 ( proposition  [ p : hs - o - ros ] and proposition  [ p : hs - cr-1br ] ) . *",
    "if @xmath45 admits an elliptic chain , then it is contained in the _ basin of attraction _ @xmath192_m)$ ] ( see definition  [ d : basin ] ) of a curve @xmath193 admitting an open rosary of even length such that @xmath194_m , \\rho ) < 0 $ ] . hence such curves are hilbert unstable ( propositions  [ p : hs - echain ] and [ p : basin - cr-1br ] ) and we obtain @xmath195    \\(3 ) we prove  c - semistable @xmath196 chow semistability \" , and use it to establish ",
    "h - semistability @xmath196 hilbert semistability \" .    *",
    "the only possible chow semistable replacement of a c - stable curve is itself ( see theorem  [ t : partial ] ) .",
    "thus c - stable curves are chow stable and hence hilbert stable .",
    "* we show that any strictly c - semistable curve @xmath45 is contained in a basin of attraction of a distinguished c - semistable curve @xmath197 with one - parameter isomorphism such that @xmath198 ( see proposition  [ p : degenerate ] ) .",
    "indeed , we choose @xmath197 so that it has closed orbit in the locus of c - semistable points ( cf .",
    "proposition  [ p : c - minorbit ] ) . *",
    "if @xmath45 is strictly c - semistable , its pseudo - stabilization @xmath37 has elliptic bridges . for any such @xmath37",
    ", there is a distinguished strictly c - semistable curve @xmath197 such that its basins of attraction contain every c - semistable replacement for @xmath37 .",
    "futhermore , _ every _ possible chow - semistable replacement for @xmath37 is contained in some basin of attraction @xmath199 with @xmath200 . since one of these",
    "must be chow semistable , every one is chow semistable ( see lemma  [ l : flat limit ] ) . *",
    "the hilbert semistable curves form a subset of the set of chow semistable curves .",
    "we first identify the chow semistable curves admitting one - parameter subgroups that are hilbert - destabilizing .",
    "then we show that any curve that is hilbert unstable but chow semistable arises in the basin of attraction of such a curve .",
    "these basins of attraction consist of the curves that are c - semistable but not h - semistable .",
    "thus the h - semistable curves are hilbert semistable (  [ ss : hs ] ) .",

    "the monomials @xmath271 of degree @xmath189 not contained in @xmath272 form a basis for @xmath273 .",
    "we reformulate gieseker s stability criterion for hilbert points @xcite in these terms :    [ prop : stabcrit2 ] the hilbert - mumford index of @xmath249_m$ ] with respect to a one - parameter subgroup @xmath204 with weights @xmath274 is given by @xmath275_m , \\rho ) = \\frac{m p(m)}{n+1 } \\sum r_i -\\sum_{j=1}^{p(m ) } wt_{\\rho}(x^{a(j)})\\ ] ] where @xmath276 index the monomials of degree @xmath189 not contained in @xmath272 .",

    "we say that the tacnodes in the family @xmath681 are _ compatible _ , and that two curves are _ compatible _ if one can be obtained from the other by replacing some tacnodes by compatible tacnodes .",
    "in this section , we show that if a curve is not c - semistable then it has unstable chow point :    [ p : chow - imply - c ] if @xmath682 is chow semistable then @xmath613 is c - semistable .",
    "we prove this by finding one - parameter subgroups destabilizing curves that are not c - semistable .",
    "many statements in this section are fairly direct generalizations of results in @xcite and @xcite .      a chow semistable bicanonical curve @xmath45 can not have a triple point , since @xmath683 and this implies that @xmath45 is chow unstable by proposition 3.1 of @xcite .",
    "we need to show that among the double points , only nodes , ordinary cusps and tacnodes are allowed .",

    "it is an easy consequence of ( ii ) of the following proposition , which , in mumford s words , says that the degrees of the components of @xmath45 are roughly in proportion to their _ natural _ degrees .",

    "let @xmath45 be a bicanonical curve . by proposition  [ prop : hilbtochow ] , @xmath45 is chow semistable if it is hilbert semistable .",
    "note that by definition , if @xmath45 does not admit an elliptic chain , then @xmath45 is c - semistable if and only if it is h - semistable . combining this with proposition  [ p : chow - imply - c ] ,",
    "we obtain :    [ p : hilb - imply - h ] if a bicanonical curve is hilbert semistable and does not admit an elliptic chain , then it is h - semistable .",
    "we shall have completed the implication @xmath813 once we prove that a hilbert semistable curve does not admit an elliptic chain .",
    "we accomplish this in proposition  [ p : echain - unstable ] and corollary  [ c : basin - cr-1br ] .",
    "in this section , we classify c - semistable curves with infinite automorphisms .     "an open rosary of length @xmath51 has arithmetic genus @xmath823 .",
    "note that an open rosary of length @xmath824 is naturally an open elliptic chain of length @xmath825 .",
    "we say that a curve @xmath45 _ admits an open rosary _ or length @xmath51 if there is a @xmath140-pointed open rosary @xmath815 and a morphism @xmath826 such that    * @xmath68 is an isomorphism onto its image over @xmath827 ; * @xmath70 are nodes of @xmath45 ; we allow the case @xmath71 .    a _ closed rosary _",
    "@xmath45 is a curve admitting @xmath67 as above with the second condition replaced by    * @xmath828 at a tacnode of @xmath45 .",
    "a _ closed rosary with broken beads _ is a curve expressible as a union of open rosaries .",
    "[ rem : rosary ] if @xmath45 admits an open rosary of length @xmath829 then @xmath45 admits a weak elliptic chain .",
    "if @xmath51 is even then @xmath45 admits an elliptic chain .",
    "thus a closed rosary of even length is also a closed weak elliptic chain .",
    "[ p : rosary - aut ] consider the closed rosaries of genus @xmath830 .",
    "if the genus is even then there is a unique closed rosary @xmath45 ( of the given genus ) and the automorphism group @xmath831 is finite .",
    "if the genus is odd then the closed rosaries depend on one modulus and the connected component of the identity @xmath832 is isomorphic to @xmath375 .",
    "there is a unique open rosary @xmath833 of length @xmath51 .",
    "if @xmath834 denotes the automorphisms fixing @xmath40 and @xmath41 then @xmath835 it acts on tangent spaces of the endpoints with weights satisfying @xmath836    let @xmath45 be a closed @xmath51-rosary obtained by gluing @xmath51 smooth rational curves @xmath837\\}$ ] so that @xmath838 let @xmath42 be another such rosary with the gluing data @xmath839    consider the morphism @xmath840 between the normalizations of @xmath45 and @xmath42 given by @xmath841 \\mapsto [ \\b_i s_i ' , t_i'].$ ] for @xmath265 to descend to an isomorphism from @xmath45 to @xmath42 , the following is necessary and sufficient :    @xmath842 this gives rise to @xmath843 and @xmath844 . solving for @xmath845 , we get @xmath846    when @xmath51 is odd , there is no constraint and all @xmath51-rosaries are isomorphic .",
    "when @xmath847 , @xmath848 forces the condition @xmath849 this means that the @xmath850-rosaries are parametrized by @xmath851    to describe the automorphisms we take @xmath852 .",
    "when @xmath51 is odd we get @xmath853 for each @xmath234 which implies that @xmath832 is trivial . when @xmath854 we get a unique solution @xmath855 and thus @xmath856 .",
    "the open rosary case entails exactly the same analysis , except that we omit the gluing datum @xmath857 associated with the end points .",

    "_ breaking the @xmath234th bead _ of a rosary ( open or closed ) , we mean replacing @xmath817 with a union @xmath858 of smooth rational curves meeting in a node such that @xmath859 meets @xmath860 in a tacnode @xmath861 and @xmath862 meets @xmath819 in a tacnode @xmath863 ( figure  [ f : breaking - bead ] ) .",
    "[ p : hsinf ] a c - semistable curve @xmath45 of genus @xmath864 has infinite automorphisms if and only if    1 .",
    "@xmath45 admits an open rosary of length @xmath84 , or 2 .",
    "@xmath45 is a closed rosary of odd genus ( possibly with broken beads ) .",
    "we have already seen in proposition  [ p : rosary - aut ] that closed rosaries of odd genus have infinite automorphisms .",
    "let @xmath45 be a c - semistable curve of genus @xmath865 that is not a closed rosary .",
    "for @xmath45 to have infinitely many automorphisms , it must have a smooth rational component , say @xmath454 . to satisfy the stability condition and",
    "still give rise to infinite automorphisms , @xmath454 has to meet the rest of the curve in one node and a tacnode , or in two tacnodes .",
    "we examine each case below :    \\(1 ) @xmath454 meets the rest in one node @xmath866 and in a tacnode @xmath867 : for the automorphisms of @xmath454 to extend to automorphisms of @xmath45 , the irreducible component @xmath868 containing @xmath867 must be a smooth rational component - this follows easily from that an automorphism of @xmath45 lifts to an automorphism of its normalization . also , @xmath455 has to meet the rest of the curve in one point @xmath869 other than @xmath867 since otherwise @xmath870 would be an elliptic tail ( or @xmath871 and @xmath45 is of genus two ) .",
    "\\(2 ) @xmath454 meets the rest in two tacnodes @xmath866 and @xmath867 : for the automorphisms to extend to @xmath45 , the components @xmath872 containing @xmath866 and @xmath873 containing @xmath867 must be smooth rational curves .",
    "hence @xmath45 contains @xmath874 which is a rosary of length three .",
    "moreover , @xmath193 and @xmath455 do not intersect : if they do meet , say at @xmath869 , then either @xmath875 and the genus of @xmath45 is of genus three ( if @xmath869 is a node ) or @xmath45 is a closed rosary if @xmath869 is a tacnode .    iterating , we eventually produce an open rosary @xmath876 of length @xmath829 containing @xmath454 as a bead .",
    "[ c : hsinf1 ] an h - semistable curve @xmath45 of genus @xmath877 has infinite automorphisms if and only if    1 .",
    "@xmath45 admits an open rosary of odd length @xmath878 , or 2 .",
    "@xmath45 is a closed rosary of odd genus ( possibly with broken beads ) .",
    "let @xmath45 be a c - semistable curve and suppose @xmath37 is a deligne - mumford stabilization of @xmath45 .",
    "in other words , there exists a smoothing of @xmath45 @xmath879 such that @xmath880 in the moduli space of stable curves . here , a smoothing is a flat proper morphism to a smooth curve with distinguished point @xmath881 such that @xmath882 and the generic fiber is smooth .",
    "our classification result ( proposition  [ p : hsinf ] ) has the following immediate consequence :    [ c : hsinf ] suppose @xmath45 is a c - semistable curve with infinite automorphism group",
    ". then the deligne - mumford stabilization and the pseudo - stabilization of @xmath45 admit an elliptic bridge .",
    "indeed , @xmath45 necessarily admits a tacnode which means that its stabilization contains a connected subcurve of genus one meeting the rest of the curve in two points .",
    "we will eventually give a complete description of the semistable and stable points of @xmath156 and @xmath157 .",
    "for our immediate purpose , the following partial result will suffice :    [ t : partial ] if @xmath45 is c - stable , i.e. , a pseudostable curve admitting no elliptic bridges , then @xmath883 . thus the hilbert point @xmath190_m",
    "\\in \\hg2^{s , m}$ ] for @xmath320 .",
    "the git - stable loci @xmath172 and @xmath884 , contain the nonsingular curves by @xcite .",
    "( we discussed the relation between chow and asymptotic hilbert stability in section  [ subsect : cphs ] . )",
    "recall that proposition  [ p : embedcstable ] guarantees that c - semistable curves admits bicanonical embeddings .",
    "in particular , this applies to pseudostable curves without elliptic bridges .",
    "suppose that @xmath45 is a singular pseudostable curve without elliptic bridges .",
    "assume that @xmath627 is _ not _ in @xmath172 .",
    "if @xmath627 is strictly semistable then it is c - equivalent to a semistable curve @xmath42 with infinite automorphism group .",
    "it follows that @xmath45 is a pseudo - stabilization of @xmath42 , and we get a contradiction to corollary  [ c : hsinf ] .",
    "suppose @xmath627 is unstable and let @xmath42 denote a semistable replacement ( see theorem  [ t : ss - replacement ] ) . by uniqueness of the pseudo - stabilization",
    ", @xmath42 is not pseudostable but has @xmath45 as its pseudo - stabilization .",
    "it follows that @xmath42 has a tacnode .",
    "however , the pseudo - stabilization of such a curve necessarily contains an elliptic bridge .    with our current partial understanding of the git of bicanonical curves",
    ", we are ready to prove theorem  [ t : main12 ] .",
    "our main task is to establish isomorphisms ( [ eqn : tmain1 ] ) and ( [ eqn : tmain2 ] ) .",
    "proposition  [ p : makepsi ] established the existence of a birational contraction morphism @xmath885 .",
    "the first step here is to show that @xmath886 and @xmath887 are birational contractions of @xmath9 and small contractions of @xmath173 . in particular",
    ", we may identify the divisor class groups of these git quotients with the divisor class group of @xmath173 ( which in turn is a subgroup of the divisor class group of @xmath9 ) .",
    "furthermore , we obtain @xmath888 and lemma  [ l : logterm ] gives @xmath889    the second step is to compute the induced polarizations of @xmath886 and @xmath887 in the divisor class group of @xmath173 .",
    "this will show that @xmath890 ( resp .",
    "@xmath891 ) is ample on @xmath886 ( resp .",
    "@xmath887 ) . isomorphisms ( [ eqn : tmain1 ] ) and ( [ eqn : tmain2 ] ) then follow from ( [ e : smallproj ] ) .    to realize our git quotients as contractions of @xmath9",
    ", we apply theorem  [ thm : getcontraction ] in the bicanonical case . consider the complement of the deligne - mumford stable curves @xmath892 in the git - semistable locus @xmath171 ; we must show this has codimension @xmath84 . since @xmath893 and @xmath894 is an isomorphism where @xmath895 denotes the cycle class map from @xmath278 to @xmath896 , the analogous statement for the hilbert scheme follows immediately .",
    "proposition  [ p : chow - imply - c ] implies @xmath897 parametrizes    * pseudostable curves that are not deligne - mumford stable , i.e. , those with cusps ; and * c - semistable curves with tacnodes .",
    "the cuspidal pseudostable curves have codimension two in moduli ; the tacnodal curves have codimension three .",
    "indeed , a generic tacnodal curve of genus @xmath10 is determined by a two - pointed curve @xmath52 of genus @xmath38 and an isomorphism @xmath898 .",
    "we conclude there exist rational contractions @xmath899 and @xmath900 .",
    "it remains to show that we have small contractions @xmath901 and @xmath902 . to achieve this",
    ", we must establish that @xmath77 is the unique exceptional divisor of @xmath903 ( resp .",

    "proposition  [ prop : hilbtochow ] ) , i.e. , @xmath906 when @xmath907 .",
    "it suffices then to observe that @xmath85 is the unique divisorial component of @xmath908 , which is guaranteed by theorem  [ t : partial ] .",
    "theorem  [ thm : getcontraction ] gives moving divisors on @xmath9 inducing the contractions @xmath903 and @xmath904 .",

    "thus we have @xmath912 and @xmath913 using the identity @xmath914 we obtain ( for @xmath320 ) @xmath915 and @xmath916 it follows then that @xmath917 and @xmath918    the proof of theorem  [ t : main12 ] will be complete if we can show that @xmath153 is the flip of @xmath8 . more precisely , for small positive @xmath165 , @xmath153 is a small modification of @xmath83 with @xmath919 ample . since @xmath161 and @xmath160 ar both small contractions of @xmath83 , @xmath153 is small as well .",
    "and the polarization we exhibited on @xmath160 gives the desired positivity , which completes the proof of theorem  [ t : main12 ] .",
    "in this section , we analyze whether c - semistable curves are git - semistable with respect to the one - parameter subgroups of their automorphism group .",
    "we shall also use deformation theory to classify the curves that belong to basins of attraction of such curves .",
    "our analysis will focus primarily on the hilbert points .",
    "indeed , corollary  [ c : all - m ] shows that we can recover the sign of the hilbert - mumford index of the chow point from the indices of the hilbert points . and",

    "the local analytic equation is given by @xmath1060 and @xmath375 acts on the local parameters @xmath1061 and @xmath1062 with weight @xmath1063 .",
    "hence @xmath375 acts on the local versal deformation space ( defined by @xmath1064 ) with weight @xmath1065 . at the adjacent tacnode , @xmath375 acts on the tangent space",
    "to the two branches with positive weights : the tangent lines are traced by @xmath1066 and @xmath1067 .",
    "in fact , @xmath375 acts on the local versal deformation of the tacnode ( defined by @xmath1068 ) with a positive weight vector @xmath1069 .",
    "similar analysis reveals that @xmath375 acts on the subsequent tacnode with a negative weight vector @xmath809 . using the symmetry of the rosary",
    ", we can conclude that @xmath375 acts on the local versal deformation space of the tacnodes with weight vector alternating between @xmath1070 and @xmath1071 .",
    "the assertion now follows .",

    "just as in the proof of proposition  [ p : hs - echain ] , the basin of attraction @xmath1152 does not contain smoothings of the tacnodes in @xmath1153 but does contain all smoothings of the remaining tacnodes . choosing the negative @xmath1149 suitably large in absolute value , we can assume each @xmath1154 , so the nodes where two rosaries meet are smoothed provided at least one of the adjacent tacnodes is _ not _ smoothed .",
    "thus @xmath1152 consists of the c - semistable curves obtained by smoothing all the tacnodes _ not _ indexed by @xmath1155 , as well as the nodes on the rosaries containing one of the remaining tacnodes ( indexed by @xmath1155 ) .",
    "the generic member of the basin equals the generic configuration indexed by @xmath1155 , as described in remark  [ r : subsets ] .",
    "it follows that _ each _ curve @xmath42 enumerated in lemma  [ l : possibilities ] appears in the the basin of attraction of @xmath1156 for a suitable one - parameter subgroup @xmath1157 .",
    "let @xmath42 denote a strictly c - semistable curve , with tacnodes and/or elliptic bridges .",
    "assume that @xmath42 is chow unstable and let @xmath1100\\ ] ] be a smoothing .",
    "let @xmath1158 be a chow semistable reduction of this family ( see theorem  [ t : ss - replacement ] ) and @xmath45 the pseudostable reduction .",
    "reversing the steps outlined in lemma  [ l : possibilities ] , we see that @xmath45 is obtained by replacing each tacnode of @xmath42 ( or @xmath1158 ) with an elliptic bridge and then pseudo - stabilizing .",
    "let @xmath197 denote the curve obtained from @xmath45 in proposition  [ p : degenerate ] , which guarantees that @xmath1159 and @xmath1160 are contained in basins of attraction @xmath199 and @xmath1161 respectively .",
    "moreover , since @xmath1162 lemma  [ l : flat limit ] implies that @xmath42 ( resp .",
    "@xmath1158 ) is chow semistable iff @xmath45 is chow semistable .",
    "this contradicts our assumption that @xmath42 is chow unstable .",
    "if @xmath45 is a strictly c - semistable curve with closed orbit then @xmath1163 where @xmath1164 is the number of tacnodes and the superscript @xmath1165 denotes the connected component of the identity .",
    "assume that @xmath42 is a strictly semistable curve with closed orbit .",
    "let @xmath45 be a pseudostable reduction and @xmath197 the curve specified in proposition  [ p : degenerate ] , so the chow point of @xmath42 is in the basin of attraction of the chow point of @xmath197 . since @xmath197 is chow semistable ,",
    "we conclude that @xmath1166 .",
    "conversely , suppose @xmath42 is a curve satisfying the three conditions of proposition  [ p : c - minorbit ] .",
    "again , let @xmath45 be a pseudostable reduction of @xmath42 and @xmath197 the curve obtained in proposition  [ p : degenerate ] , so that @xmath42 is in the basin of attraction of @xmath197 for some one - parameter subgroup @xmath1140 .",
    "note that @xmath197 also satisfies the conditions of proposition  [ p : c - minorbit ] .",
    "the basin of attraction analysis in section  [ s : ba - o - ros ] implies that any nontrivial deformation of @xmath197 in @xmath199 induces a nontrivial deformation of at least one of the singularities of @xmath197 sitting in an open rosary .",
    "there are three cases to consider : first , we could deform the tacnode on one of the rosaries @xmath1134 .",
    "however , then the rosary @xmath1134 deforms to an elliptic bridge in @xmath42 that is not a length two rosary , which yields a contradiction .",
    "therefore , we may assume that none of the tacnodes in @xmath197 is deformed in @xmath42 .",
    "second , we could smooth a node where length two rosaries meet .",
    "however , this would yield a rosary in @xmath42 of length @xmath609 .",
    "finally , we could smooth a node where a length two rosary @xmath1134 meets a component not contained in an rosary .",
    "however , the tacnode of @xmath1134 then deforms to a tacnode of @xmath42 not on any length two rosary .",
    "suppose that @xmath45 is a h - semistable bicanoncal curve . by definition",
    "it is also c - semistable and thus chow - semistable by the analysis of section  [ ss : csbc ] . of course",
    ", strictly chow - semistable points can be hilbert unstable , and we classify these in two steps .",
    "first , we enumerate the curves @xmath193 with strictly semistable chow point such that there exists a one - parameter subgroup @xmath1167 destabilizing the hilbert point of @xmath193 , i.e. , with @xmath194_m,\\rho)<0 $ ] for @xmath907 .",
    "second , we list the curves that are in the basins of attraction @xmath1168_m)$ ] , which are also guaranteed to be hilbert unstable by the hilbert - mumford one - parameter subgroup criterion .",
    "proposition  [ p : destabilize ] shows these are _ all _ the hilbert unstable curves : if @xmath45 is a c - semistable bicanonical curve that is hilbert unstable then its chow point is contained in the basin of attraction @xmath1169 of a chow semistable curve @xmath193 with closed orbit such that @xmath194_m , \\rho ) < 0.$ ]      suppose that @xmath193 has open rosaries @xmath1171 .",
    "each contributes @xmath375 to the automorphism group of @xmath193 and @xmath1172 .",
    "let @xmath1173 denote the nodes in the intersection @xmath1174 .",
    "the automorphism coming from @xmath1175 gives rise to a one - parameter subgroup @xmath1176 where the second @xmath375 means the @xmath234th copy in the product @xmath1177 and @xmath1178 is the stabilizer group .",
    "we assume that @xmath1179 are open rosaries of even length and @xmath1180 are of odd length . for @xmath1181 ,",
    "the weights of @xmath1130 on the versal deformation spaces of @xmath752 and @xmath1142 have the same sign ( see  [ s : ba - o - ros ] ) .",
    "we normalize @xmath1130 so that this weight is negative .",
    "given our one - parameter subgroups @xmath1182 with @xmath194_m,\\rho)<0 $ ] , we can expand @xmath1183 so that @xmath1184_m , \\rho )     = \\sum_{i=1}^k   a_i \\ , \\mu([c_0]_m , \\rho_i ) + \\sum_{i = k+1}^\\ell b_i \\ , \\mu([c_0]_m , \\rho_i ) < 0.\\ ] ] we have already computed these terms : proposition  [ p : hs - o - ros ] implies that @xmath194_m,\\rho_i)=0 $ ] for @xmath1185 and @xmath194_m,\\rho_i)=1-m$ ] for @xmath1186 .",
    "thus in order for the sum to be negative , we must have @xmath1187 for some @xmath1186 .",
    "in particular , there is at least one rosary of even length .",
    "proposition  [ p : hs - echain ] implies that the basin of attraction @xmath1168_m)$ ] contains curves with elliptic chains , which are not h - semistable .",
    "we are left with the case of a closed rosary @xmath1033 of even genus with one broken bead .",
    "there is a unique one - parameter subgroup @xmath188 of the automorphism group , and we choose the sign so that it destabilizes @xmath1033 ( cf .",
    "proposition  [ p : hs - cr-1br ] ) .",
    "the basin of attraction analysis in proposition  [ p : basin - cr-1br ] again shows that the curves with unstable hilbert points admit elliptic chains .",
    "we shall now prove that if @xmath45 is h - stable then it is hilbert stable .",
    "if @xmath45 is hilbert strictly semistable , then it belongs to a basin of attraction @xmath192_m)$ ] where @xmath193 is a hilbert semistable curve with infinite automorphisms and @xmath188 is a 1-ps coming from @xmath1170 . by corollary",
    "[ c : hsinf ] , @xmath193 admits an open rosary of odd length @xmath878 or is a closed rosary of even length @xmath877 .",
    "but we showed in propositions [ p : hs - echain ] and [ p : gen - ss - c ] that any curve in the basin of such @xmath193 has a weak elliptic chain and hence is not h - stable .",
    "suppose @xmath42 is strictly h - semistable .",
    "we shall show that there exists a curve @xmath1189 satisfying the conditions of proposition  [ p : h - minorbit ] and a one - parameter subgroup @xmath1140 of @xmath1190 such that @xmath1191_m \\in a_{\\rho'}([c^{\\ast}]_m)$ ] for @xmath907 and @xmath1192_m,\\rho')=0 $ ] .",
    "assume first that @xmath42 is a closed weak elliptic chain with @xmath51 components , with arithmetic genus @xmath1193 .",
    "let @xmath1189 denote a closed rosary with beads @xmath1194 and tacnodes @xmath1195 .",
    "proposition  [ p : rosary - aut ] implies @xmath1196 , generated by a one - parameter subgroup @xmath188 acting on the versal deformation spaces of the @xmath1197 with positive weights and the @xmath1198 with negative weights .",
    "proposition  [ p : gen - ss - c ] implies @xmath1199_m)$ ] contains the closed weak elliptic chains of length @xmath51 .",
    "now assume that @xmath42 is not a closed weak elliptic chain but contains maximal closed weak elliptic chains @xmath1200 of lengths @xmath1201 .",
    "let @xmath1202 ( resp .",
    "@xmath1203 ) denote the node ( resp .",
    "tacnode ) where @xmath1204 meets the rest of the curve .",
    "let @xmath1189 be the curve obtained from @xmath42 by replacing each @xmath1205 with a chain of @xmath1206 open rosaries of length three .",
    "precisely , write @xmath1207 and let @xmath1208 denote a chain of @xmath1206 open rosaries of length three joined end - to - end",
    ". then @xmath1189 is obtained by gluing @xmath1209 to @xmath37 via nodes at @xmath1202 and @xmath1203 .",
    "one special case requires further explanation : if @xmath42 admits an irreducible component @xmath1210 meeting the rest of @xmath42 at two points @xmath1142 and @xmath1203 then we contract this component in @xmath1189 .",
    "there are examples where the construction of @xmath1189 involves components being contracted .",
    "let @xmath454 and @xmath455 be smooth and connected of genus @xmath84 and let @xmath1211 and @xmath1212 be elliptic . consider the curve @xmath42 @xmath1213 replacing the weak elliptic chains with rosaries of length three yields @xmath1214 which is not h - semistable .",
    "contracting the middle @xmath583 , we obtain @xmath1189 : @xmath1215      we return to our proof : the curve @xmath1189 has @xmath1219 essentially repeating the argument of proposition  [ p : degenerate ] , using the one - parameter subgroup analysis of proposition  [ p : hs - o - ros ] and the basin - of - attraction analysis of proposition  [ p : hs - echain ] ( or proposition  [ p : hs - cr-1br ] and [ p : basin - cr-1br ] in the generate case ) , we obtain a one - parameter subgroup @xmath1140 in the automorphism group such that @xmath1191_m \\in a_{\\rho'}([c^{\\ast}]_m)$ ] for @xmath907 and @xmath1192_m,\\rho')=0 $ ] .",
    "we now show that the curves enumerated in proposition  [ p : h - minorbit ] all have closed orbits . due to ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 1.4 ) , it suffices to show none of these are contained in the basin of attraction of any other .",
    "suppose that @xmath1220 and @xmath1221 are such that @xmath1222_m \\in a_{\\rho}([c^{\\ast}_1]_m)\\ ] ] for some one - parameter subgroup @xmath188 of @xmath1223 .",
    "a nontrivial deformation of @xmath1220 necessarily deforms one of the singularities of @xmath1220 .",
    "if the singularity is a tacnode on a length - three open rosary , the resulting deformation admits a weak elliptic chain that is not contained in a chain of length - three rosaries .",
    "if the singularity is a node where two length - three open rosaries meet then the deformation admits a weak elliptic chain _ not _ contained in a chain of length - three open rosaries .",
    "however , there is one case that requires special care : suppose that @xmath1220 is a closed chain of @xmath51 rosaries of length three @xmath1224 where @xmath1225 and @xmath814 meet at a node @xmath1226 ; this has arithmetic genus @xmath1193 .",
    "let @xmath1221 denote a closed rosary of genus @xmath1193 , which is a deformation of @xmath1220 .",
    "we need to insure that @xmath1227_m \\not \\in a_{\\rho}([c^{\\ast}_1]_m)\\ ] ] for any one - parameter subgroup @xmath188 of @xmath1228_m)^{\\circ}$ ] .",
    "we can express @xmath1229 where @xmath1230 acts trivially except on @xmath1144 and has weights @xmath812 and @xmath1063 on @xmath1231 and @xmath1232 .",
    "( here @xmath1233 acts with weights @xmath812 and @xmath1063 on @xmath1234 and @xmath1235 . )",
    "however , assuming @xmath188 is nontrivial , one of the following differences @xmath1236 is necessarily negative ; for simplicity , assume @xmath1237 .",
    "it follows that @xmath188 acts with negative weight on the versal deformation of the node @xmath1238 , thus deformations in @xmath1239_m)$ ] can not smooth @xmath1238 .",
    "we conclude that deformations in the basin of attraction of @xmath1220 can not smooth each node , which yields ( [ eqn : tricky ] )                                brendan hassett .",
    "classical and minimal models of the moduli space of curves of genus two . in _ geometric methods in algebra and number theory _ , volume 235 of _ progress in mathematics _ , pages 160192 .",
    "birkhuser , boston , 2005 .",
    "jnos kollr and shigefumi mori .",
    ", volume 134 of _ cambridge tracts in mathematics_. cambridge university press , cambridge , 1998 . with the collaboration of c. h. clemens and a. corti , translated from the 1998 japanese original .",
    "jnos kollr . , volume  32 of _ ergebnisse der mathematik und ihrer grenzgebiete .",
    "3 . folge . a series of modern surveys in mathematics [ results in mathematics and related areas .",
    "3rd series .",
    "a series of modern surveys in mathematics]_. springer - verlag , berlin , 1996 .",
    "david mumford , john fogarty , and frances kirwan .",
    ", volume  34 of _ ergebnisse der mathematik und ihrer grenzgebiete ( 2 ) [ results in mathematics and related areas ( 2)]_. springer - verlag , berlin , third edition , 1994 ."

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we give a geometric invariant theory ( git ) construction of the log canonical model @xmath0 of the pairs @xmath1 for @xmath2 $ ] for small @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> we show that @xmath4 is isomorphic to the git quotient of the chow variety bicanonical curves ; @xmath5 is isomorphic to the git quotient of the asymptotically - linearized hilbert scheme of bicanonical curves . in each case </S>",
    "<S> , we completely classify the ( semi)stable curves and their orbit closures . </S>",
    "<S> chow semistable curves have ordinary cusps and tacnodes as singularities but do not admit elliptic tails . </S>",
    "<S> hilbert semistable curves satisfy further conditions , e.g. , they do not contain elliptic bridges . we show that there is a small contraction @xmath6 that contracts the locus of elliptic bridges . </S>",
    "<S> moreover , by using the git interpretation of the log canonical models , we construct a small contraction @xmath7 that is the mori flip of @xmath8 . </S>"
  ]
}
